p: Multiple runs were carried out to obtain the EOs and only one fraction was collected for each individual herb. The receiver vessel was not cooled, it remained at room temperature (<20 °C). The oil was then separated and passed over anhydrous sodium sulfate. The oil was filtered using filter paper and kept at 4 °C in sealed vials in the dark, up to 24 hours with the aim of ensuring that oxidative degradation has not occurred, for later use. Test were done immediately after the extraction in order to avoid degradation or changes in the samples’ composition. EOs were obtained in a yield of 0.13%, 0.33% and 0.23% w/w for A. graveolens., T. vulgaris and C. sativum, respectively.
